metadata.title: CVE-2018-5142 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
If Media Capture and Streams API permission is requested from documentswith "data:" or "blob:" URLs, the permission notifications do not properlydisplay the originating domain. The notification states "Unknown protocol"as the requestee, leading to user confusion about which site is asking forthis permission. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 59.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
